final_answer:
The humor in this image comes from the juxtaposition between the two panels. On the left, labeled "YES," we see a serene underwater scene with beautiful fish and colorful coral, which represents the idealized view of snorkeling.

On the right panel, labeled "BUT," the reality is shown: a crowded underwater scene with people's legs and bodies disrupting the view. The snorkeler is reaching towards swimmers instead of fish or coral, subverting the expectation set by the first panel.

This contrast highlights the common experience of having an idyllic expectation disrupted by reality, creating a humorous and relatable situation.
